page.title: 19FARMING
page.content: A Farmer at Stourmouth has 800 acres, some of orchard, the rest cereals and vegetables in rotation. Newest 'break' crop is{Oil Seed rape.}He keeps no stock, although his father had many sheep. The land here (brickearth over sand) is so good it is wasted as pasture. His farm is totally mechanised with few workers and a 40 hour week.{Changes:}The farm is a combination of 8 smaller farms which employed many more workers. They were market garden, hops, orchard, and soft fruit farms. Hopfields have disappeared from the area, but {orchards remain}as the soil is ideal for fruit trees. Old orchards are being grubbed out to make room for new kinds of fruit, the trees planted so as to make{mechanised picking possible. Farmers regret some changes but find them economically inevitable.
